dmcaPage.faqDescription: Answers to the most common DMCA, safe harbor, and counter notice questions.

faqs.question: What information is required for a DMCA notice?
faqs.answer: Provide the work description, original and infringing URLs, contact email, and a good-faith statement.

faqs.question: How long does the process take?
faqs.answer: We aim to respond within 1–3 business days and will email you if more details are needed.

faqs.question: When does Safe Harbor apply?
faqs.answer: When a platform isn’t directly involved in infringement and removes content promptly after a valid notice.

faqs.question: Can I send a counter notice?
faqs.answer: Yes. If you believe your content was removed by mistake, submit a counter notice with supporting reasoning.

dmcaLearn.heroTitle: DMCA Protects Both Platforms and Creators
dmcaLearn.heroIntro: The 1998 Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) establishes safe-harbor rules that keep online services open while providing creators with a fast path to remove infringing content.

sections.title: DMCA Overview
body: DMCA limits a service provider’s direct liability for user-uploaded content while requiring takedown of infringing material after a valid notice.
Publishing a contact channel, keeping records, and offering counter-notice paths help platforms retain Safe Harbor protection.
list: Notice-and-takedown: remove content quickly after valid notice
Counter-notice: allow alleged infringers to appeal
Repeat infringer policy: warn, restrict, or terminate offenders

sections.title: Service Provider Duties
body: Platforms should respond promptly, keep logs, and maintain reporting and counter-notice channels while avoiding policies that encourage infringement.
SkyBox’s flow covers intake, verification, moderation, and transparent communication with both sides.
list: Publish DMCA contact and privacy practices
Provide traceable forms and timelines for counter notices

sections.title: Why It Matters to Creators
body: DMCA lets creators request removals without filing lawsuits—just submit a description, links, and a sworn statement.
If content is removed in error, creators can file a counter notice and request restoration.
list: Respecting others’ rights prevents repeat-infringer strikes

faqs.title: What materials do I need?
faqs.answer: Prepare a description of the work, proof of ownership, original and infringing URLs, and a good-faith statement.

faqs.title: How quickly do you respond?
faqs.answer: Expect an initial update in 1–3 business days. We’ll email you if we need more details.

faqs.title: How do counter notices work?
faqs.answer: If your content was removed incorrectly, submit a counter notice explaining why it is lawful. We review and restore when appropriate.

faqs.title: What happens to repeat infringers?
faqs.answer: Accounts that repeatedly violate valid notices may face restrictions or termination to protect the community.
